headline: Constellation Brands Profit, Sales Decline Amid Softer Consumer Demand
summary: Chief Executive Bill Newlands said the company continued to face softer consumer demand in the quarter. Beer sales are expected to be flat to up 3% and wine and spirits sales down 17% to 20%.

headline: Corona beer maker Constellation Brands misses quarterly estimates amid tariff woes
summary: Constellation Brands missed first-quarter sales and profit estimates on Tuesday, as fears of rising tariffs and economic uncertainty prompted consumers to reduce purchases of beers and wines. U.S. alcoholic beverage makers have faced a double blow from the Trump administration's shifting trade policies, a challenge that comes at a time when the industry is already grappling with tepid demand. Corona beer maker reported net sales of $2.52 billion for the quarter ended May 31, compared with analysts' average estimate of $2.55 billion, according to data compiled by LSEG.

Corona beer maker reported net sales of $2.52 billion for the quarter ended May 31, compared with analysts' average estimate of $2.55 billion, according to data compiled by LSEG.

headline: Constellation Brands misses Q1 profit, keeps comparable outlook
summary: Investing.com -- Constellation Brands reported weaker‑than‑expected first‑quarter earnings on Tuesday but stuck with its full‑year profit forecast, betting solid demand for its Modelo Especial and Corona beer franchises will offset higher costs later in the year.Shares of the brewer were down 1.7% in aftermarket trading at $163.56.

headline: Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ) Misses Q2 Revenue Estimates
summary: Beer, wine, and spirits company Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales falling 5.5% year on year to $2.52 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $3.22 per share was 2.3% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ) Misses Q2 Revenue Estimates

headline: Constellation Brands: Fiscal Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The Rochester, New York-based company said it had net income of $2.90 per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, came to $3.22 per share. The results fell short of Wall Street expectations.

headline: Constellation Brands, AstraZeneca, casino stocks: Trending Tickers
summary: Constellation Brands (STZ) stock rises ahead of the Modelo maker's earnings report. AstraZeneca (AZN) CEO reportedly wants to move the company's listing to the US to avoid UK market restrictions, according to reporting from The Times. Casino stocks, including Las Vegas Sands (LVS) and Wynn (WYNN), are climbing after Macau gaming sales beat expectations, according to a government report. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts here.

headline: Nonalcoholic Drinks Are Popular. That Could Hurt Constellation Brands.
summary: Alcohol is no longer in vogue, and booze companies like  Constellation Brands  are feeling the pinch.  The beer, wine, and spirit seller is set to report earnings on Tuesday after the market closes.  For the three months ended in May, analysts polled by FactSet expect  Constellation  to post net sales of $2.55 billion, down 4% from a year ago.

headline: Jobs Report, Fed Speakers, Megabill Deadline: What to Watch This Week
summary: Nonfarm payrolls for June, and ISM purchasing managers indexes for manufacturing and services, will give insights into U.S. economic growth. Meantime, Republicans are rushing to get the tax-and-spending megabill to President Trump's desk by Friday.
